text: Bryan Henare (born 24 September 1974 in Auckland, New Zealand) is a former professional rugby league footballer. Henare was usually a or a second-rower. ==Playing career== ===Auckland Rugby League=== An Otahuhu Leopards junior, Henare toured Great Britain in 1993 with the Junior Kiwis and he represented a New Zealand President's XIII in 1996. Henare also toured with the New Zealand Māori rugby league team in 1995.Lion Red Rugby League Annual 1995, New Zealand Rugby Football League, 1995. p.179 Henare played in the Lion Red Cup in 1995 for the Auckland Warriors colts side. Early on in his career Henare attracted interest from the Wigan Warriors but eventually opted to remain in Auckland.Andrew Sanders Henare sets sights on Wigan Sunday Star Times, 12 May 1996Wigan's strife of Bryan Sunday Mirror, 26 May 1996 ===National Rugby League=== Henare played for the Auckland Warriors, making their first grade squad in 1996. He played in 22 games for the club, although a serious knee injury hampered his 1998 season.summon Henare BBC.com, 17 December 1999 In 1999 Henare represented Auckland South in the National Provincial Competition. ===Super League=== Henare moved to England, signing with St. Helens at the start of the 2000 season. Having won the 1999 Championship, St. Helens contested in the 2000 World Club Challenge against National Rugby League Premiers the Melbourne Storm, with Henare playing at second-row forward in the loss. He was with the club for two years before moving to the Oldham Bears in 2002, initially on loan. Henare then moved to the Leigh Centurions at the start of 2003.Henare tied up by Red Tape Lancashire Evening Telegraph, 23 January 2003 ==References== ==External links== *Players profile at rugbyleague.co.nz *Saints Heritage Society profile *VODAFONE WARRIORS 1995-2008 (PLAYER ROSTER) *SL stats Category:1974 births Category:Living people Category:Auckland rugby league team players Category:Featherstone Rovers players Category:Junior Kiwis players Category:Leigh Centurions players Category:New Zealand Māori rugby league players Category:New Zealand Māori rugby league team players Category:New Zealand rugby league players Category:New Zealand Warriors players Category:Oldham R.L.F.C. players Category:Otahuhu Leopards players Category:Rugby league hookers Category:Rugby league second-rows Category:St Helens R.F.C. players
title: Bryan Henare
